cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.IR. 

This paper deals with building goal-oriented conversation systems, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). The paper specifically focuses on code-mixed conversations, which involves mixing two or more languages in a single conversation. This is a common phenomenon in multilingual regions such as India. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with NLP and linguistic aspects of computing. Other likely sub-categories include cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), and cs.IR (Information Retrieval), as these sub-categories also deal with aspects of building conversational systems and language processing.
